channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping outside shop needs moving., 19th September
item.description:
Some inconsiderate person has flytipped a whole load of branches outside no 7 on pavement. Please look at any CCTV in Chatterton road. Find them and prosecute the evil people who do this pretty please!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chatterton Road, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Green bin full with rubbish, 19th September
item.description:
There is an abandoned green bin left outside 34 Halliwick Road, on the street that belongs to no one on the street. It has been filled with rubbish over a long time and is too heavy to remove. Please could you arrange for collection of the bin. I have asked all the neighbours and no one wants it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Halliwick Road, Colney Hatch, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside and near 14, 19th September
item.description:
Historic and protected cobbles removed to facilitate utility works. Asphalt has been placed instead of replacing the cobbles
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leeke Street, King's Cross, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Idle roadwork contractors, 19th September
item.description:
Good Afternoon, I am writing to make a formal complaint about the lack of progress and ongoing disruption from the roadworks that have been going on in Kendal Street and Connaught Street for over a year. For over a year the residents of Connaught Square have been suffering from a lack of residents parking due to the removal of residents parking in Connaught Street and Kendal Street for roadworks which seem to never end. Since the beginning of September you have now in addition removed around 20% of the parking spaces in Connaught Square to use as a parking space for machinery and a dumping ground for materials causing traffic to build up both in Connaught Street and also in the Square itself . As you know the square is a one way street now its often impossible to drive round the square often a necessity due to the lack of free spaces due to the traffic queues in connaught street blocking access to the east side of the square. What's even more frustrating is that your contractors are hardly ever there if they do show up they literally only work for about 1 or 2 hours at day at most some days including today they havenâ€™t even shown up at all. How is this remotely acceptable? I believe the works are primarily for CS3 which the vast majority of residents have objected too whilst nevertheless being forced to pay for it no doubt from our council taxes , The least the council could do is at least ensure that your contractors actually work every single day for several hours a day to finish the project and minimise the disruption. Please can whoever in the council responsible for the project get on top of your contractors and get them to work a full days work at least for five days a week with a view to finishing rather that dragging this project out for months and months . Yours sincerely, Nishat Sattar Paice 42 Connaught Square
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Carriage Drive, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Human feces on pavement, 19th September
item.description:
There are piles of human fecal matter and feces smeared on the pavement from being stepped on by pedestrians. Please clean it up and sanitize the pavement.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Green, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bread and litters dumped on planted area on Crossway, 19th September
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Crossway, Hackney, London

item.title: Street lamps use high power bulbs and shine into our house, 19th September
item.description:
One of the street lights on the garages on the north side of the Thorburn square has been replaced recently and the new bulbs are so powerful we have had to put blackout masks up in our childrens bedrooms in addition to blackout curtains. It doesn't stop the constant bright light all night into the upstairs of our house. The streetlights face the side of our house, behind the north side of the garages. Please change the shades on the top of the lampposts so that the light from these street lamps doesn't shine into our house.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thorburn Square, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Human feces and smears on the street, 19th September
item.description:
There are multiple piles of feces and smears of fecal matter on the pavements on John Campbell Road and on the south side of Crossway. It poses a great public health risk. Please remove the feces and clean up the smears on the pavement.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Crossway, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road signs, 19th September
item.description:
The turn left sign that is painted on the road at the junction of bellegrove way and welling way needs to be repainted.there are lots of cars that carry straight on either not seeing that it is left turn only or ignoring it.this may be the cause of several accidents heree,the latest one resu;ting in a car going through the motorcycle shop window.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Welling Way, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
